Package exe.memorymanager

Interface Summary
ParserConstants  
 

Class Summary
AllocationExpression An allocation expression of the form: new Node( '', )
BooleanExpression A boolean expression
CompoundBooleanExpression A boolean expression
DataExpression A data expression of the form 'X' or
LayoutDirective A layout directive, such as a suggested grid position for a new pointer
memorymanager  
OpAssign An assignment operation: LHS = RHS where LHS is a non-null PointerExpression and RHS is a PointerExpression
OpAssignAllocate An assignment operation: LHS = RHS where LHS is a non-null PointerExpression and RHS is an AllocationExpression
OpBreak A break statement
OpDataAssign An assignment operation: LHS = RHS where LHS is a DataExpression and RHS is a DataExpression or char literal
OpDeclare A declaration operation: Node *;
OpDeclareAllocateAssign A declaration operation of the form: Node * =
OpDeclareAssign A declaration operation of the form: Node * = (->next)*; or Node * = NULL;
OpDelete An assignment operation: LHS = RHS where LHS is a non-null PointerExpression and RHS is a PointerExpression
Operation The root of the hierarchy of pointer operations
OpForPointer A FOR loop in which the control variable is a pointer
OpIf An IF-THEN-ELSE statement
OpLayout An hint for the layout manager
OpNone A NOOP.
OpWhile A while command
Parser  
ParserTokenManager  
PointerExpression A pointer expression may be of one of two types: 1.
SimpleCharStream An implementation of interface CharStream, where the stream is assumed to contain only ASCII characters (without unicode processing).
Token Describes the input token stream.
 

Exception Summary
BreakException  
MemoryManagerException  
ParseException This exception is thrown when parse errors are encountered.
